input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Lisa: What do you think of this one? 
Marion: Eh, so so. 
Lisa: And this one? Too flashy? 
Marion: Nah, not too flashy. 
Lisa: Uhg! And this sweater from my aunt? Isn't it hideous? 
Marion: I guess. 
Lisa: Are you even listening? I'm trying to have a conversation with you. 
Marion: And I'm trying to watch the game, but you're yapping on about your new clothes! 
Lisa: Well I have to decide which gifts to keep and which to exchange for better ones when I go to the Boxing Day sales this afternoon! 
Marion: Well could you do me the favor of making this quick? It's the third quarter and you've been blabbering on since the first! 
Lisa: Oh, your precious game. You watch the same game every year, and each year your beloved hometown team loses by at least three goals! 
Marion: Oh no you didn't. You didn't just insult the Sals-bury Seals, did you? Why don't you just. just go and return all of those stupid clothes and not come back until the sales are over? 
Lisa: I might just! Enjoy your stupid game! 

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: In this conversation, Lisa tries to get Marion's opinion on her new clothes, but Marion is distracted by the football game and not interested. Lisa gets annoyed by Marion's lack of attention and eventually insults Marion's team. Marion gets upset and suggests that Lisa return the clothes and go elsewhere until the sales are over. Lisa responds by saying she might just do that.
input_text.Response B: Lisa is trying on new clothes and asking Marion's opinion. But Marion is busy watching the football game, so he's annoyed by Lisa's chatter. Then the argument starts because of different preferences on football game and clothes.
